sentences.sContent: The agency has been vilified by some doctors for being unnecessarily slow to approve life-saving drugs.
sentences.sCn: 该机构因对救生药物的审批速度过慢而备受一些医生的诽谤。

sentences.sContent: He was vilified, hounded, and forced into exile by the FBI.
sentences.sCn: 他遭到了联邦调查局的诽谤和追捕，被迫流亡国外。

words.tran: 卑鄙的；邪恶的；低廉的；肮脏的

trans.tranCn: 诽谤， 辱骂； 贬低， 轻视
trans.tranOther: If you are vilified by someone, they say or write very unpleasant things about you, so that people will have a low opinion of you
